# Magic Circle Firm Defers Partner Compensation, Delays Bonus Payments, And More
## Magic Circle firms are also feeling the pinch.
By [Kathryn Rubino](https://abovethelaw.com/author/krubino/)  
onApril 21, 2020 at 3:07 PMApril 21, 2020 at 3:22 PM
16
Shares[](https://twitter.com/share?url=https://abovethelaw.com/2020/04/magic-circle-firm-defers-partner-compensation-delays-bonus-payments-and-more/&text=Magic%20Circle%20Firm%20Defers%20Partner%20Compensation,%20Delays%20Bonus%20Payments,%20And%20More)[](https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https://abovethelaw.com/2020/04/magic-circle-firm-defers-partner-compensation-delays-bonus-payments-and-more/&display=popup&ref=plugin&src=share_button)[](https://www.linkedin.com/shareArticle?mini=true&url=https://abovethelaw.com/2020/04/magic-circle-firm-defers-partner-compensation-delays-bonus-payments-and-more/)[](javascript:void("#ea-share-count-email"))


The thing about pandemics is, well, that they’re everywhere. That’s the whole “pan” part. Global law firms have unique challenges that impact the way they’re dealing with COVID-19 and the economic upheaval surrounding it.

Magic Circle firm Clifford Chance, which is the 7th largest in the world under the Global 200 index, is joining the COVID-19 austerity measures. So [what is Clifford Chance doing](https://www.law.com/2020/04/21/clifford-chance-defers-partner-distributions-in-virus-response-292-65630/)? They’re deferring global partner distributions, salary reviews and raises are frozen, and while bonuses will be paid, the timing of said payments may be delayed. The good news is that the firm is not currently planning on any layoffs or furloughs.

[  ](https://abovethelaw.com/wp-admin/post.php?post=1052766&action=edit)
[Sponsored](https://abovethelaw.com/wp-admin/post.php?post=1052766&action=edit)
### [ Generative AI In Legal Work — What’s Fact And What’s Fiction? ](https://abovethelaw.com/wp-admin/post.php?post=1052766&action=edit) 
Zach Warren from the Thomson Reuters Institute discusses the potential and the pitfalls.
From [THOMSON REUTERS](https://abovethelaw.com/wp-admin/post.php?post=1052766&action=edit)  
The firm made the following statement about their cost-cutting measures:

“We are a strong and resilient organisation, with over five years of robust global growth behind us. Our teams are always a source of huge pride, they are fantastically talented, motivated and collaborative, and never more so since the virus has begun to spread.

Over the coming months our aim is to keep these teams together and to work shoulder to shoulder with our clients who need our support now more than ever.”

If your firm or organization is slashing salaries, closing its doors, or reducing the ranks of its lawyers or staff, whether through open layoffs, stealth layoffs, or voluntary buyouts, please don’t hesitate to let us know. Our vast network of tipsters is part of what makes Above the Law thrive. You can [email us](mailto:tips@abovethelaw.com?subject=%5BFirm%20Name%5D%20Layoffs/Salary%20Cuts) or text us (646-820-8477).

If you’d like to sign up for ATL’s Layoff Alerts, please scroll down and enter your email address in the box below this post. If you previously signed up for the layoff alerts, you don’t need to do anything. You’ll receive an email notification within minutes of each layoff, salary cut, or furlough announcement that we publish.

# We Finally, Really, May Be Nearing The End Of The Dewey & LeBoeuf Case
## It's been going on longer than the firm at this point.
By [Joe Patrice](https://abovethelaw.com/author/joe-patrice/)  
onAugust 16, 2022 at 10:48 AMAugust 17, 2022 at 3:57 PM
3
Shares[](https://twitter.com/share?url=https://abovethelaw.com/2022/08/we-finally-really-may-be-nearing-the-end-of-the-dewey-leboeuf-case/&text=We%20Finally,%20Really,%20May%20Be%20Nearing%20The%20End%20Of%20The%20Dewey%20&%20LeBoeuf%20Case)[](https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https://abovethelaw.com/2022/08/we-finally-really-may-be-nearing-the-end-of-the-dewey-leboeuf-case/&display=popup&ref=plugin&src=share_button)[](https://www.linkedin.com/shareArticle?mini=true&url=https://abovethelaw.com/2022/08/we-finally-really-may-be-nearing-the-end-of-the-dewey-leboeuf-case/)[](javascript:void("#ea-share-count-email"))
If you loved the end of Lord of the Rings — where all the action was resolved but it kept going for 45 minutes anyway — then you must love the tale of Dewey & LeBoeuf, the short-lived Biglaw merger that crumbled in the face of the Great Recession. The recriminations have long outlived the firm’s entire run as an entity, featuring a rare firm bankruptcy and some dubious criminal prosecutions. Now, after eight years, the last piece of ongoing Dewey drama may be coming to a close.

In [a Friday letter](https://fingfx.thomsonreuters.com/gfx/legaldocs/gdpzyonobvw/SEC%20v%20Davis%20et%20al%20-%20Sanders%20settlement%20offer.pdf), the SEC informed Judge Valerie Caproni that it has agreed in principle to a settlement agreement with former Dewey & LeBoeuf CFO Joel Sanders. The SEC says the proposed settlement awaits approval by the Commission and expects to have a final answer for the judge in six to eight weeks.

This comes on the heels of the [new short documentary](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=i0p-pMHwusw) featuring the former head of the merged entity, Steven Davis, [offering his take](https://abovethelaw.com/2022/08/lets-all-watch-dewey-leboeuf-burn-again/) on the crisis that felled the firm.

[  ](https://bit.ly/3x7bHOy)
[Sponsored](https://bit.ly/3x7bHOy)
### [ Legal AI: 3 Steps Law Firms Should Take Now ](https://bit.ly/3x7bHOy)
If 2023 introduced legal professionals to generative AI, then 2024 will be when law firms start adapting to utilize it. Things are moving fast, so…
From [LexisNexis](https://bit.ly/3x7bHOy)  
Sanders was the only Dewey & LeBoeuf executive convicted in the Manhattan DA’s questionable prosecution of firm leadership. After hyping up the idea that the firm lied to investors about the firm’s financial position, the DA ultimately dropped claims against Steven Davis and lost the case against the firm’s executive director, Stephen DiCarmine. Sanders earned a million dollar fine.

But the SEC’s desire for a pound of flesh isn’t tempered by state law fines so it’s been going after Sanders ever since. But maybe we’ve finally reached the end.

So, as much as I hate to write it, we’ll close on the obligatory: Dewey think this is the end of the case?

[SEC deal could end ex-Dewey & LeBoeuf CFO’s long-running legal trouble](https://www.reuters.com/legal/legalindustry/sec-deal-could-end-ex-dewey-leboeuf-cfos-long-running-legal-trouble-2022-08-15/) [Reuters]

# Guy Tries To Marry His Computer -- AGAIN -- As Stupid Anti-Marriage Equality Protest
## Porn addict protests marriage equality in the stupidest way imaginable. And this isn't the first time he's tried this stunt.
By [Joe Patrice](https://abovethelaw.com/author/joe-patrice/)  
onApril 19, 2016 at 1:07 PMApril 19, 2016 at 1:25 PM
41
Shares[](http://twitter.com/share?url=http://abovethelaw.com/2016/04/guy-tries-to-marry-his-computer-again-as-stupid-marriage-equality-protest/&text=Guy%20Tries%20To%20Marry%20His%20Computer%20—%20AGAIN%20—%20As%20Stupid%20Anti-Marriage%20Equality%20Protest)[](http://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=http://abovethelaw.com/2016/04/guy-tries-to-marry-his-computer-again-as-stupid-marriage-equality-protest/&display=popup&ref=plugin&src=share_button)[](http://www.linkedin.com/shareArticle?mini=true&url=http://abovethelaw.com/2016/04/guy-tries-to-marry-his-computer-again-as-stupid-marriage-equality-protest/)[](javascript:void("#ea-share-count-email"))
It’s been a couple of years since we had to write about Vandy Law grad Chris Sevier, and he decided to remedy that with another ridiculous bit of prosanity: [suing for the right to marry his laptop](https://abovethelaw.com/2016/04/guy-tries-to-marry-his-computer-again-as-stupid-marriage-equality-protest/2/) in Texas. If that sounds familiar, it’s because he did the [exact same thing](https://abovethelaw.com/2014/05/apple-porn-guy-wants-to-marry-his-porn-filled-computer-lets-all-laugh-at-his-motion/) in the Florida marriage equality fight.

Apparently the media is astounded at the absurdity of this (as seen [here](http://metro.co.uk/2016/04/19/man-wants-to-marry-his-macbook-to-protest-same-sex-marriage-5827405/) or [here](https://www.rawstory.com/2016/04/accused-stalker-trying-to-undo-same-sex-marriage-by-suing-for-right-to-marry-his-prn-filled-computer/) or [here](http://uproxx.com/webculture/chris-sevier-suing-texas-laptop-same-sex-marriage-laptop/)). Welcome aboard the Chris Sevier train! Wait until they hear about the time he [sued Obama over Duck Dynasty](https://abovethelaw.com/2013/12/apple-porn-guy-sues-obama-for-firing-duck-dynasty-guy/).

We started covering Chris back when he was just a boy, standing in front of a computer, asking it [why he’s so addicted to porn](https://abovethelaw.com/2013/07/lawyer-apple-should-protect-me-from-my-porn-addiction/). Those were such innocent days for the now-serial litigant. Since then he’s matured into a diehard opponent of marriage equality by demanding the right to marry his computer. Looks like someone’s just looking to trade in his spouse for a newer model in a couple years!

[  ](https://abovethelaw.com/wp-admin/post.php?post=1052766&action=edit)
[Sponsored](https://abovethelaw.com/wp-admin/post.php?post=1052766&action=edit)
### [ Generative AI In Legal Work — What’s Fact And What’s Fiction? ](https://abovethelaw.com/wp-admin/post.php?post=1052766&action=edit) 
Zach Warren from the Thomson Reuters Institute discusses the potential and the pitfalls.
From [THOMSON REUTERS](https://abovethelaw.com/wp-admin/post.php?post=1052766&action=edit)  
In any event, Sevier’s stupid protest — which has rolled through Florida and Utah — has hit Texas, and Governor Greg “[I hate dildos](https://abovethelaw.com/2016/04/ted-cruz-is-no-fan-of-dildos/)” Abbott and Attorney General Ken “I [got my own](https://abovethelaw.com/2015/08/texas-attorney-general-slapped-with-three-felony-counts/) ongoing [legal problems](http://www.statesman.com/news/news/feds-accuse-ag-ken-paxton-of-fraud/nq3xR/)” Paxton are not happy for the help. Despite hating the thought of same-sex marriage, the two archconservatives are eager to rid the courts of this sideshow. You’d almost think Sevier was working some high-level irony by exposing the absurdity of those who claim Obergefell opened the door to marrying inanimate objects, but nope! He’s [either serious](http://www.houstonpress.com/news/man-thinks-he-can-reverse-same-sex-marriage-by-fighting-to-marry-his-laptop-8328641) or in character so deep that Daniel Day-Lewis is like, “dude, take it down a notch.”

“[This lawsuit] is not a matter of who’s on the right side of history,” Sevier said. “This is about who is on the right side of reality. Are we just delusional?”

“We” aren’t, no. But we may know someone who is…

(If you want to read the last non-pornographic thing to come out of Sevier’s computer, it’s on the next page…)

[Morning Docket](https://abovethelaw.com/morning-docket/)
# Morning Docket: 11.22.16
By [Staci Zaretsky](https://abovethelaw.com/author/staci-zaretsky/)  
onNovember 22, 2016 at 8:56 AMNovember 21, 2016 at 10:26 PM
18
Shares[](http://twitter.com/share?url=http://abovethelaw.com/2016/11/morning-docket-11-22-16/&text=Morning%20Docket:%2011.22.16)[](http://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=http://abovethelaw.com/2016/11/morning-docket-11-22-16/&display=popup&ref=plugin&src=share_button)[](http://www.linkedin.com/shareArticle?mini=true&url=http://abovethelaw.com/2016/11/morning-docket-11-22-16/)[](javascript:void("#ea-share-count-email"))
* Many law school deans are opposed to the ABA’s proposal to require 75 percent of graduates sitting for a bar exam to pass it within two years, but this is perhaps one of the more absurd arguments offered against the rule: “Nobody looks at what percentage of Ph.D.s end up as college professors, or what percentage of M.B.A.s achieve their goal.” [[Wall Street Journal](http://www.wsj.com/articles/law-school-accreditors-raising-the-bar-1479751011)]

* Unlike what has happened in the past with certain of President-elect Donald Trump’s personal and business settlements, the Trump Foundation will not be paying for any part of the $25 million settlement in the Trump University fraud class-action case. Trump will happily take the tax deduction instead. [[DealBook / New York Times](http://www.nytimes.com/2016/11/21/business/dealbook/trump-foundation-wont-pay-any-of-25-million-university-settlement.html?ref=dealbook)]


[  ](https://abovethelaw.com/wp-admin/post.php?post=1052766&action=edit)
[Sponsored](https://abovethelaw.com/wp-admin/post.php?post=1052766&action=edit)
### [ Generative AI In Legal Work — What’s Fact And What’s Fiction? ](https://abovethelaw.com/wp-admin/post.php?post=1052766&action=edit) 
Zach Warren from the Thomson Reuters Institute discusses the potential and the pitfalls.
From [THOMSON REUTERS](https://abovethelaw.com/wp-admin/post.php?post=1052766&action=edit)  
* According to Erica Moeser, president of the NCBE, there’s been a slight uptick in bar exam scores across the country. “The big picture item is that we have looked for scores to continue to drop, and they didn’t,” said Moeser, who now seems to have a glass-half-full perspective on the state of bar exam passage rates in America. [[ABA Journal](http://www.abajournal.com/news/article/some_states_see_increase_in_state_bar_pass_rates_while_others_witness_decli)]

* In case you didn’t recall, there will be a retrial for Stephen DiCarmine and Joel Sanders, the former executive director and former chief financial officer of failed firm Dewey & LeBoeuf, and the judge on the case says it could be “as long or longer” than their first trial, which ended in a mistrial. Dewey care anymore? [[New York Law Journal](http://www.newyorklawjournal.com/id=1202772843046/Dewey-Retrial-May-Take-Longer-Than-The-First?mcode=1202617075486&curindex=1&curpage=ALL)]

* Kirk Nurmi, the lawyer who defended Jodi Arias through two trials, has agreed to be disbarred rather than face an ethics hearing for writing a book about the case prior to the completion of his client’s appeal of her life sentence. Nurmi wrote the book for “self-enrichment,” but he’d already made $1.3 million for defending Arias. [[Arizona Republic](http://www.azcentral.com/story/news/local/phoenix/2016/11/21/jodi-arias-attorney-kirk-nurmi-state-bar-of-arizona-disbarment-tell-all-book/94239560/)]

# Stat Of The Week: Off The Road Again
## Clients are cutting budgets for their meetings with their friends.
By [Jeremy Barker](https://abovethelaw.com/author/jbarker/)  
onSeptember 3, 2021 at 4:46 PMSeptember 3, 2021 at 1:57 PM
0
Shares[](https://twitter.com/share?url=https://abovethelaw.com/2021/09/stat-of-the-week-off-the-road-again/&text=Stat%20Of%20The%20Week:%20Off%20The%20Road%20Again)[](https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https://abovethelaw.com/2021/09/stat-of-the-week-off-the-road-again/&display=popup&ref=plugin&src=share_button)[](https://www.linkedin.com/shareArticle?mini=true&url=https://abovethelaw.com/2021/09/stat-of-the-week-off-the-road-again/)[](javascript:void("#ea-share-count-email"))
For Biglaw’s corporate clients, business travel is set to permanently remain below pre-pandemic levels, and travel for internal meetings will see the deepest cuts. 

[That’s according to a Bloomberg survey](https://www.bloomberg.com/news/features/2021-08-31/will-business-travel-come-back-data-show-air-hotel-travel-forever-changed) of 45 large businesses, which found that 84% plan to cut their travel budgets after the pandemic, with most of these seeing reductions of 20%-40%. 

While executives told Bloomberg they will still shell out for travel for important business development efforts, they also noted that other travel will be even more closely reviewed. 

As the CEO of Europe’s biggest paint maker put it: “Trips to drum up business could drop by a third, and internal meetings by even more.” 

[‘Forever Changed’: CEOs Are Dooming Business Travel — Maybe for Good](https://www.bloomberg.com/news/features/2021-08-31/will-business-travel-come-back-data-show-air-hotel-travel-forever-changed) [Bloomberg]

Jeremy Barker is the director of content marketing for Breaking Media. Feel free to [email him](mailto:jbarker@breakingmedia.com) with questions or comments and to [connect on LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/in/jeremy-barker-5316a230/).

# Morning Docket: 07.03.19
## * “Everyone in America counts in the census, and today’s decision means we all will.” The Justice Department has officially confirmed that in light of the Supreme Court’s recent decision, a citizenship question will not be added to the 2020 Census. [[Washington Post](https://www.washingtonpost.com/local/social-issues/2020-census-will-not-include-citizenship-question-doj-confirms/2019/07/02/0067be4a-9c44-11e9-9ed4-c9089972ad5a_story.html)] * Has Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg handed off the high court’s liberal torch to Justice Elena Kagan? Based on the fact that the Notorious RBG assigned the dissent in the partisan gerrymandering case, it sure looks like it. [[NPR](https://www.npr.org/2019/07/02/737725994/6-takeaways-from-a-consequential-supreme-court-term)] * Dozens of prominent Republicans plan to submit an amicus brief to the Supreme Court in support of a “common sense, textualist” ruling that the Civil Rights Act outlaws discrimination against LGBT people in the workplace. [[New York Times](https://www.nytimes.com/2019/07/02/us/politics/gay-rights-republicans.html)] * Allen & Overy and O'Melveny & Myers are still in merger talks, but this has been going on for more than a year now and it seems like it's taking forever for anything to happen. [[American Lawyer](https://www.law.com/2019/07/02/ao-and-omelveny-toil-over-talks-as-clock-ticks-on-merger/)] * Michael Avenatti, the [Lawyer of the Year](https://abovethelaw.com/2019/01/above-the-laws-2018-lawyer-of-the-year-contest-the-winner/) accused of bank fraud and embezzlement, is refusing to give up his desktop, iPhone, and iPad passwords to federal prosecutors in New York. [[Big Law Business](https://biglawbusiness.com/avenatti-wont-cough-up-iphone-ipad-passwords-to-prosecutors)]
By [Staci Zaretsky](https://abovethelaw.com/author/staci-zaretsky/)  
onJuly 3, 2019 at 8:23 AMJuly 2, 2019 at 6:50 PM
0
Shares[](https://twitter.com/share?url=https://abovethelaw.com/2019/07/morning-docket-07-03-19/&text=Morning%20Docket:%2007.03.19)[](https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https://abovethelaw.com/2019/07/morning-docket-07-03-19/&display=popup&ref=plugin&src=share_button)[](https://www.linkedin.com/shareArticle?mini=true&url=https://abovethelaw.com/2019/07/morning-docket-07-03-19/)[](javascript:void("#ea-share-count-email"))

(Photo by MANDEL NGAN/AFP/Getty Images)

[Morning Docket](https://abovethelaw.com/morning-docket/)
# Morning Docket: 05.22.17
## * Joe Lieberman is senior counsel at Kasowitz Benson, one of President Donald Trump's go-to law firms, and now that he's considered to be a frontrunner for FBI director, someone has been desperately trying to edit the firm's Wikipedia page to remove Trump from its list of notable clients. Gizmodo did some investigation as to who was trying to cover up the fact that Lieberman has a relationship with Trump's longtime lawyer, Marc Kasowitz. [[Gizmodo](http://gizmodo.com/someone-is-trying-to-scrub-trumps-name-from-the-wikiped-1795397966)] * Now that Robert Mueller has been [appointed as special counsel](https://abovethelaw.com/2017/05/biglaw-partner-named-special-counsel-in-russia-investigation/) in the investigation of possible Russian interference in the 2016 election, the DOJ is exploring possible conflicts of interest with his former law firm, WilmerHale. Coincidentally, the firm represents former Trump campaign chairman Paul Manafort, Trump’s daughter, Ivanka, and his son-in-law, Jared Kushner, but its GC says Mueller had nothing to do with those matters. [[Washington Post](https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/justice-department-will-review-possible-ethics-conflicts-involving-muellers-former-law-firm/2017/05/18/fff63f00-3bfa-11e7-a058-ddbb23c75d82_story.html?utm_term=.15a27ebaace1)] * "You ain't going to impeach nobody. Try it and we will lynch all of you. You'll be hanging from a tree." Rep. Al Green (D-Texas) called for the impeachment of President Donald Trump on the House floor last week, and now he's being threatened. Green is unwilling to allow the racial hostility to deter him from doing the "right thing," which he believes, in this case, means proceeding with impeachment proceedings against the president. [[Houston Chronicle](http://m.chron.com/news/houston-texas/article/Racial-slurs-thrown-at-Al-Green-after-calling-for-11161204.php#photo-12928983)] * Much has gone down in the [$50 million Jane Doe/Proskauer gender discrimination case](https://abovethelaw.com/2017/05/inside-the-50-million-gender-discrimination-case-a-partner-filed-against-proskauer-rose/) since we last checked in. It seems that one judge ruled that Doe need not be unmasked and may continue to use a pseudonym in her action against the firm, and another judge ordered that notes from Doe's mediation with the firm be preserved, as she claims that a fellow partner allegedly threatened to fire her because of her complaints while there. [[ABA Journal](http://www.abajournal.com/news/article/judge_allows_lawyer_to_sue_proskauer_for_alleged_gender_bias_under_pseudony)] * "I’ve never known how many students didn’t come because of the old building. I’m quite certain that none came because of the old building." Twenty years and $80 million dollars later, and the University of South Carolina School of Law finally has a shiny new building to show off that the administration is hoping will not only entice new students to enroll, but also increase its U.S. News law school ranking next year. The school is currently tied for 88th place. [[Post and Courier](http://www.postandcourier.com/business/university-of-south-carolina-hopes-new-law-school-building-woos/article_69f1137a-3c1f-11e7-942a-8be61d361168.html)]
By [Staci Zaretsky](https://abovethelaw.com/author/staci-zaretsky/)  
onMay 22, 2017 at 8:59 AMMay 21, 2017 at 10:40 PM
1

* Joe Lieberman is senior counsel at Kasowitz Benson, one of President Donald Trump’s go-to law firms, and now that he’s considered to be a frontrunner for FBI director, someone has been desperately trying to edit the firm’s Wikipedia page to remove Trump from its list of notable clients. * Now that Robert Mueller has been [appointed as special counsel](https://abovethelaw.com/2017/05/biglaw-partner-named-special-counsel-in-russia-investigation/) in the investigation of possible Russian interference in the 2016 election, the DOJ is exploring possible conflicts of interest with his former law firm, WilmerHale. Coincidentally, the firm represents former Trump campaign chairman Paul Manafort, Trump’s daughter, Ivanka, and his son-in-law, Jared Kushner, but its GC says Mueller had nothing to do with those matters. [[Washington Post](https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/justice-department-will-review-possible-ethics-conflicts-involving-muellers-former-law-firm/2017/05/18/fff63f00-3bfa-11e7-a058-ddbb23c75d82_story.html?utm_term=.15a27ebaace1)]

* “I’ve never known how many students didn’t come because of the old building. The school is currently tied for 88th place. ### [ How Will Walgreens’ Expansion Into Specialty Pharmacy Affect The Industry? ](https://medcitynews.com/2024/04/walgreens-specialty-pharmacy-drugs/)
Walgreens announced that it is expanding its specialty pharmacy offerings. Experts think that this move could yield several strategic benefits, given the higher profit margins associated with specialty medications compared to traditional drugs. They also think Walgreens’ move could lead to greater competition, consolidation, and innovation within the broader pharmacy industry.
By KATIE ADAMS - MEDCITY NEWS
